name: Oil Free Super Crispy Fries
description: Super crispy oil-free "fries". An inexpensive, kid-friendly side or main dish. Serve with your favorite vegetable such as roasted broccoli or a large salad, or alongside some veggie burgers.
recipeIngredient: 4-5 pounds russet potatoes (peeled and cut about 2-3 inches long)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees and prepare a large roasting pan either with parchment paper or a silicone mat. If your pans are smaller you will need two.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees and prepare a large roasting pan either with parchment paper or a silicone mat. If your pans are smaller you will need two.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the peeled and cut potatoes to a large pot. Cover with water and then add the baking soda and 1 teaspoon salt. Stir and bring to a boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the peeled and cut potatoes to a large pot. Cover with water and then add the baking soda and 1 teaspoon salt. Stir and bring to a boil.

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer for about 10 minutes, just until a little resistance is met when you insert a fork into the potato chunk. You don't want them super soft and overcooked at this point.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer for about 10 minutes, just until a little resistance is met when you insert a fork into the potato chunk. You don't want them super soft and overcooked at this point.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the potatoes, and add to a large bowl with a lid, preferably.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the potatoes, and add to a large bowl with a lid, preferably.

recipeInstructions.text: To the large bowl with the potatoes, add the remaining 1 teaspoon salt, garlic powder, onion powder, and either stir very well, or put the lid on and carefully shake the bowl until all ingredients are well combined. There will be a thick paste on the potatoes at this point; that is what you want.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the potatoes to the roasting pan(s), spreading them out evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Roast for 30 minutes, then turn the potatoes and roast for about 30 minutes more.
